item.title: Autotalker with a difference
item.dc:creator: @zdarkmage77 zdarkmage77
item.description:
@zdarkmage77 wrote:

Yes indeed very detectable. Also add arrays, rwait(if you have srl or else download it or do something like wait(randomrange(396,513)); and make sure the ranges are random and not something like 10, 25, 50, 100, 250, 1000, 60000 etc. etc.) plus mistakes (random)

Read full topic

item.title: Autotalker with a difference
item.dc:creator: @omg_omg_omg omg omg omg
item.description:
@omg_omg_omg wrote:

I’m just trying to help out, man.[br][size=1]Posted on: July 13, 2007, 11:04:43 PM[/size][hr]I don’t help people for recognition, I help them because I’m a nice person. ;)[br][size=1]Posted on: July 13, 2007, 11:05:23 PM[/size][hr][code] //~eggys autotalker~\
//my first program\
//enjoy!\
//…o…o…\
//…|…|…\
//…_________________/…\
//~instructions~\
//~1. target the rs window\
//~~2. follow the green parts :]\

program autotalker;
{.include srl\srl.scar}
const
message1 =‘write what you want it to type when you press f2 here.’;
message2 =‘write what you want it to type when you press f3 here.’;
message3 =‘write what you want it to type when you press f4 here.’;
message4 =‘write what you want it to type when you press f5 here.’;
// press f6 to stop.

begin
setupsrl;

repeat

if (isfkeydown(2)) then
begin
typesend(message1);
end else
begin
if (isfkeydown(3)) then
begin
typesend(message2);
end else;
end;
begin
if (isfkeydown(4)) then
begin
typesend(message3);
end else;
end;
begin
if (isfkeydown(5)) then
begin

typesend(message4);
end else;
end;

until(isfkeydown(6));

end.[/code]

It should work just fine, try it. It uses hotkeys to type things; something that alot more people should use.

Read full topic

@dudeofthed wrote:

This would be very detectable. Try to use the KeyDowns and KeyUp procedures and also put in a sleep time above the wait times.

But very good.

item.title: Autotalker with a difference
item.dc:creator: @eggy0095 eggy0095
item.description:
@eggy0095 wrote:

my first real script that i have made i plan to become quite an expert with SCAR so i have started small well here it is

[code] //~eggys autotalker~\
//my first program\
//enjoy!\
//…o…o…\
//…|…|…\
//…_________________/…\
//~instructions~\
//~1. target the rs window\
//~~2. follow the green parts :]\

program autotalker;
var message1: string; //dont touch these =]
message2: string;
message3: string;
message4: string;
counter: Integer;

begin
message1:= ‘hello’; //change this to what you want it to say

message2:= ‘yay’; //change this to what you want it to say

message3:= ‘hehe’; //change this to what you want it to say

message4:= ‘woot’; //change this to what you want it to say

counter:= 0 //dont touch this :]

repeat

sendkeys(message1+chr(13));
wait (4000) //change this to the time you want it to wait between typing it works in milliseconds

sendkeys(message2+chr(13));
wait (4000) //this is the wait between messages

sendkeys(message3+chr(13));
wait (4000) //this is the wait between messages

sendkeys(message4+chr(13));
wait(4000)

counter:=counter + 1; // cant touch this

until(counter = 10); //change the ten to how many times you want it to repeat

end.

[/code]
well hope you like it please give thoughts critisism ect its the only way i am going to learn!

Read full topic
